zoString.h : Conversion of strings to integers and vice versa.
[Software utilities]

Functions

 Converts an unsigned 16-bit integer to an array of two bytes.
u08 * s16ToStr (s16 data, u08 *str)
 Converts a signed 16-bit integer to an array of two bytes.
u08 * u32ToStr (u32 data, u08 *str)
 Converts an unsigned 32-bit integer to an array of four bytes.
u08 * s32ToStr (s32 data, u08 *str)
 Converts a signed 32-bit integer to an array of four bytes.
u08 * u64ToStr (u64 data, u08 *str)
 Converts an unsigned 64-bit integer to an array of eight bytes.
u08 * s64ToStr (s64 data, u08 *str)
 Converts a signed 64-bit integer to an array of eight bytes.

Detailed Description

Overview
This library provides functionality for converting strings to any kind of integer and vice versa. The string-integer union types declared in zoTypes.h are utilized to produce fast and efficient code.
Usage example 
 #include "zoTypes.h"
 #include "zoString.h"
 #include "zoUart.h"

 int main(void)
 {
    u08 str[10];                            //declare a byte array
    u64 ageOfTheEarthInYears = 4540000000;  //the age of the earth in years!
    zoUartInit();                           //initialize uart to 115200,8,N,1
                                            //refer to the uart documentation

    //send ageOfTheEarthInYears over the uart byte by byte (not digit by digit)
    zoUartPutData(u64ToStr(ageOfTheEarthInYears,str),8);
 }
